Network for a Healthy California African American Campaign
Network for a Healthy California
African American Campaign

Walking on the Path
Walking on the Path
page.title:
to Better Health
to Better Health

Walking on a Path to Better Health
Walking on a Path to Better Health
page.enlisting:
Overview •Teaches participants to view walking as a viable way to get their recommended level of physical activity at work or home. •Demonstrates how to use safe walking techniques. •Recommends walking as a way to get healthy while spending quality time with friends and family. Overview •Teaches participants to view walking as a viable way to get their recommended level of physical activity at work or home.
Overview
•Teaches participants to view walking as a viable way
to get their recommended level of physical activity at
work or home.
•Demonstrates how to use safe walking techniques.
•Demonstrates how to use safe walking techniques.
•Recommends walking as a way to get healthy while spending quality time with friends and family.
•Recommends walking as a way to get healthy while
spending quality time with friends and family.

page.title:
Learning Objective 5:
Learning Objective 5:
page.enlisting:
• Recognize walking as a way to be physically active with friends and family members. Examples include: – Establishing or participating in a neighborhood walking club – Walking your dog with your children – Walking your children to school – Others? • Recognize walking as a way to be physically active with friends and family members. Examples include:

with friends and family members. Examples include:

page.title:
Learning Objective 6:
Learning Objective 6:
page.enlisting:
• Monitor their exertion during physical activity. – Use the “talk test” • With moderate intensity you should be able to talk without • With vigorous intensity activity you should be able to say a few – Participants self-monitor by asking themselves • How does it feel? • How warm am I? • What is my breathing like? • Monitor their exertion during physical activity.
• Monitor their exertion during physical activity.

page.title:
Learning Objective 7:
Learning Objective 7:
page.enlisting:
• Name one new way to get family members to eat more fruits and vegetables. Examples include: – Eating fruit and vegetables as snacks – Preparing fruit smoothies – Adding vegetables to other meals (pasta dishes such as fettuccini alfredo with tomato, and tuna with shredded carrots) – Have children help shop for and prepare meals • Name one new way to get family members to eat more fruits and vegetables. Examples include:
